newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: Smurfit names Tony Smurfit as French CEO.
newsitem.headline: Smurfit names Tony Smurfit as French CEO.

text.p: Jefferson Smurfit Group Plc said on Monday that Tony Smurfit had been appointed to the position of chief executive of Smurfit France, effective from November 1.

The appointment will enable Pat Barrett, who has been acting chief executive of Smurfit France, to devote himself full-time to his position of chief operations officer of Smurfit Continental Europe, the company said in a statement.
Tony Smurfit is the son of chairman and chief executive officer Michael Smurfit.

He is currently deputy chief executive of Smurfit France and was previously deputy chief executive of Smurfit Socar in France. Prior to this, he held senior positions within the group's operations in the U.S. and Britain, Smurfit said.

His appointment reflects the increased scale of the group's business in France following the acquisitions of Cellulose du Pin and Les Papeteries du Limousin during the last two years, the company said.
